articles.author: By CHEYANNE MUMPHREY - AP Education Writer
articles.title: ACT test scores for US students drop to new 30year low | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: High school students scores on the ACT college admissions test have dropped to their lowest in more than three decades, showing a lack of student preparedness for collegelevel coursework, according to the nonprofit organization that administers the test. Sc
articles.content: By CHEYANNE MUMPHREY  AP Education WriterHigh school students scores on the ACT college admissions test have dropped to their lowest in more than three decades, showing a lack of student prepared [+3382 chars]
articles.summary: Scores have been falling for six consecutive years but the trend accelerated during the COVID pandemic. The average ACT composite score for U S students was out of Last year the average score was The average scores in reading science and math all were below benchmarks the ACT says students must reach to have a high probability of success in first year college courses. Many universities have made standardized admissions tests optional amid criticism that they favor the wealthy and put low income students at a disadvantage. Some including the University of California system do not consider ACT or SAT scores even if submitted.
articles.html_summary:
• Scores have been falling for six consecutive years but the trend accelerated during the COVID pandemic.
  • The average ACT composite score for U S students was out of Last year the average score was The average scores in reading science and math all were below benchmarks the ACT says students must reach to have a high probability of success in first year college courses.
  • Many universities have made standardized admissions tests optional amid criticism that they favor the wealthy and put low income students at a disadvantage.
  • Some including the University of California system do not consider ACT or SAT scores even if submitted.
